abstract: In a long-awaited report, regulators said they had identified the sequence of events that erased more than 600 points from the Dow Jones industrial average in minutes.
snippet: In a long-awaited report, regulators said they had identified the sequence of events that erased more than 600 points from the Dow Jones industrial average in minutes.
lead_paragraph: A single sale of $4.1 billion in futures contracts by a mutual fund touched off a series of events that led to the so-called flash crash, the sharp stock market decline that shook investors and markets on May 6, federal regulators said Friday.

headline.main: Single Sale of Worth $4.1 Billion Led to Flash Crash
